wikitext.*:
'''John Sprott Ryan''' ([[1929]] – [[3 July]] [[2022]])<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://tributes.smh.com.au/obituaries/450055/john-ryan/?r=https://tributes.smh.com.au/obituaries/smh-au/|articlename=John Ryan Death Notice|dated=|website=[https://tributes.smh.com.au/]|accessed=4 November 2023}}</ref> was a New Zealand born Professor of Folklore and Heritage at the University of New England, USA.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://www.une.edu.au/staff-profiles/hass/jryan|articlename=Professor John Ryan|dated=|website=[https://www.une.edu.au/]|accessed=4 November 2023}}</ref> He first joined the university in 1969 as an Associate Professor.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://www.austlit.edu.au/austlit/page/A15418|articlename=AustLit "John Ryan"|dated=|website=[https://www.austlit.edu.au/]|accessed=4 November 2023}}</ref> He had studied under [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in his Masters work at the [[University of Oxford]].<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://www.une.edu.au/connect/news/2009/09/illuminating-the-scholarly-background-to-tolkiens-storytelling|articlename=Illuminating the scholarly background to Tolkien’s storytelling|dated=|website=[https://www.une.edu.au/]|accessed=4 November 2023}}</ref>

In 1992 he was awarded an Honorary Doctorate by the [[American Tolkien Society]].

He lectured and had been published in many countries and was a visiting Professor in Folklore at the University of Sheffield in both 1995 and 1999. He also lead part of a Summer School for Tolkien Studies at the University of Otago in 2007 for Pacific Rim countries.
